author: samuraiturtle
title: Ninjago Racers
review: The cheapest way to get the black ninja (Cole) that I know of is this set.  I think it is some sort of Easter promotion (for Wal-Mart along with some others sets).  It is a basic car (my guess is some sort of go-cart) with arms to attack opponets.  It does come with two golden tooth parts witch Cole can use as daggers, but I wish it comes with a proper weapon.  I also wish Cole has a mantle to wear, but none of these set comes with a mantle.

author: yamerias
title: Could have been better...
review:
This model was given away with The Sun newspaper in the UK on 21st May 2012.

This set comprises of a go-kart style vehicle as well as a Cole ZX minifigure.

I'm not quite sure what exactly I was expecting from this set as such, but I think it could have been better...it felt like there were parts missing, like tyres for the car and a weapon for Cole.

Not a bad model for 30p though.

author: Golem25
title: A decent polybag, but not much more
review:
I managed to get this set as part of the Gamma promotion in the Netherlands. For every 50 Euro's spent, or a specific promoted item, a customer would receive a random polybag (look at the Bricklists to find out what other polybags are on offer).

I'm not a fan of the Ninjago line, but the minifig we get here (Cole ZX) is very nicely detailed, and would fit right in with any of the classic Ninja sets. His torso is printed on both sides, with his legs having received attention as well. The face sports an unamused expression and rather bushy eyebrows.

The vehicle itself is more of a let-down; there are no rubber wheels included, and the build is as straightforward as one might expect of a polybag. It does come with gold cheese slopes, two gold tusks, and a pair of grates. I also like the fact that the designers have opted for handlebars instead of a steering wheel.

Something to note is that the image on the front of the polybag is incongruent with the instructions. The curved black part over the back wheels is supposed to be placed sloping down to the back, while the cover has it the other way around.

All in all, 30087 is okay. You get a great minifig and a reasonable vehicle with a bit of articulation on the "arms" (you can pretend them to be wings, I suppose). Proper wheels and a weapon for Cole are missing, but you could always have him use the gold tusks. The only spare part included is a third gold cheese slope.

This review may have sounded a bit underwhelmed about the polybag, but make no mistake; you can't go wrong with a free giveaway, right?

author: xxlemonxcurryxx
title: Basic Set But Good Fun To Have Around
review:
It's a very small and simple set so it wasn't very fun or challenging to build but I suppose it may be better suited to those who like Lego because they enjoy playing with the finished product rather than building it. 
For the price generally charged (on eBay etc.) you don't get much in the way of parts, but you do get a minifig which I'd say makes up for that a bit. 
It's a good set to have around as it's very much playable as you have both the car and the minifigure to interact with.

author: StanSUeScotty
title: My first lego polybag!
review:
This set made me in love with lego minifigs and small sets.

How simple the parts are and how real it is to symbolize a ninja car.

I dono why it is rated so low, it's simply a gift product.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: Not bad but the name of the set
review:
Opening;

I don't like ninjago , I am just going to get that out of the way and this is one of three ninjago sets I own .

The Minifigures-

The figure has a ninja mask , determined facial expression printed torso and legs .

The build-

The build has four untyred wheels , two 1×1 pearl gold cheese slopes , a steering wheel , two gold teeth and an assembly at the back .

In conclusion-

this is a set that is ok not a game changer in any way and is much better for people who actually like the theme .
